intro: Cryptocarya subvelutina, commonly known as the velvet-leaved cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage, which gives it its common name. It typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, contributing to its unique botanical appearance.
